intro: Calyptranthes maxonii, commonly known as the Hawaiian calyptranthes, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and clove. This evergreen shrub or small tree typically grows in moist, shaded environments within mesic forests. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a distinctive waxy texture. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that attract native pollinators such as bees and moths.
